intro: Galium tricorne, commonly known as three-lobed bedstraw, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Its stems are usually prostrate or ascending, often rooting at the nodes. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds.
